intro: Justicia austroguangxiensis f. albinervia, commonly known as the white-veined justicia, is a rare flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white veins on its leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
